title: VaViM and VaVAM: Autonomous Driving through Video Generative Modeling
author: Florent Bartoccioni (Valeo.ai), Elias Ramzi (Valeo.ai), Victor Besnier, Shashanka Venkataramanan, Tuan-Hung Vu, Yihong Xu, Loick Chambon, ..., Matthieu Cord (Valeo.ai & Sorbonne Université)
relevance_why: The principles of video generative modeling and imitation learning could inform audio-visual applications in generative AI, particularly in creating coherent, context-aware audio narratives.
background: Developing an autonomous driving framework that uses generative video models to predict future driving trajectories based on visual inputs and high-level goals.
contribution: This paper introduces VaViM, an auto-regressive video model, and its companion VaVAM to create a perception-to-action system for autonomous driving, demonstrating the transferability of video generative pre-training to driving tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models focused primarily on generating visually appealing videos without direct relevance to real-world applications in driving.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes learned video representations to drive vehicles, marking a significant step towards integrating generative models into practical autonomous systems.

key_innovation: Combines a video generative model with an action module for real-time decision-making in autonomous driving, using spatio-temporal features extracted from video inputs.
real_world_impact: This research has the potential to advance the safety and robustness of autonomous driving systems by leveraging rich video data for enhanced decision-making.

new_terms.auto-regressive: **Auto-regressive** modeling refers to the statistical technique where current values are predicted based on past values in a sequence.
new_terms.spatio-temporal representation: **Spatio-temporal representation** denotes a data structure that captures both spatial and temporal information, crucial for analyzing dynamic processes.

open_sourcing: The code and model weights are available at [github.com/valeoai/VideoActionModel](https://github.com/valeoai/VideoActionModel).
